text: The European Economic Community was the predecessor of the European Union. It existed from 1957 to 1992, when the Treaty of Maastricht led to more cooperation between the countries of the European Union. France and Germany for the first time came together to revive their economy and maintain peace in the continent. Category:20th century in Europe Category:1957 establishments in Europe Category:1992 disestablishments in Europe
title: European Economic Community
